file_content.text: We can't hold this position, but we'll leave some surprises for Black Sun before we go.
Lost near everyone, but Salarr's dead, and the Black Sun base is in ruins.
I knew you'd rise to the occasion with my encouragement.
Well done, Sergeant.
I don't need you anymore.
Wasn't planning to stay.
Your men made excellent shock troops.
You were useful.
We did what we had to.
There aren't enough of us to hold this base. Black Sun reinforcements are coming.
Can't believe it! We just took down Salarr. Black Sun won't forget that anytime soon.
We lost some good soldiers, but this victory gives their deaths meaning.
Your men fought bravely. You should be proud.
Well done, Sergeant.
Thanks for leading this mission.
No victory can make up for all these deaths.
I wish that was true.
Maybe not, but people in this sector are safer thanks to us. That's worth a lot.
Those men died because they were weak. Forget them.
Don't mourn your losses.
Guess you save all your inspirational speeches for before battles....
Black Sun will have reinforcements here soon. Any sign of the man you came to rescue?
This is my first time seeing what a Jedi can do. I shouldn't have doubted you.
Black Sun reinforcements are coming. Whatever you're here for, I suggest you find it.
There you are... we intercepted Salarr's holocall to Tarnis. Can't believe he's a Sith!
But that's not the worst news. The Planet Prison prototype here at the lab? A fake.
Tarnis stole the real Planet Prison.
Trace that holocall you intercepted. Use it to locate our Sith's base of operations.
We have to find him.
Already working on it.
Tarnis has been playing us from the start.
Outmaneuvered again!
Playtime's over. Let's find that traitor.
Tarnis is dead. He just doesn't know it.
I'll kill him.
We need you back at the Senate tower. Kira out.
Sounds like your work is just starting. We won't hold you up. Goodbye, Jedi.
Guess you really didn't need us....
By the time we found our backbones, you were way ahead. Sorry we missed the fight.
I'm glad you at least made the effort.
Apology accepted, Sergeant.
What's done is done, Sergeant.
That doesn't matter now.
Your men would have just gotten in my way.
I'm not.
Then I guess our timing was perfect.
I hope you know what you're doing.
Corporal, get a kolto pack on that man. The rest of you, prep for evac.
Agent Galen sent me. What's happened?
Black Sun. They're not a gang anymore. They're an army.
We were securing a perimeter around their base for you. They hit back with military-grade weapons. Killed six of my men.
Seven, sir. Jorin's gone.
We're not equipped for this fight--not anymore. We can't help you.
No need to panic. We'll figure something out.
Calm yourself, Sergeant.
All due respect, you don't have a clue what you're up against.
You're telling me Coruscant's finest can't handle some gangsters?
But they're just criminals.
You'll finish the mission whether you're equipped for it or not.
I give the orders here.
I don't take orders from you--and we didn't sign up for a suicide run.
We've been fighting Black Sun for months. Now with new weapons and armor, they're unstoppable.
Jedi + T7 = stop the unstoppable every day
Look at us. We're half-dead, and they didn't suffer a single casualty. There's no hope of victory.
If you surrender now, your soldiers will have died in vain. Is that what you want?
There is always hope.
What about the man inside that base waiting to be rescued? You'd abandon him?
This is a moment of truth, Sergeant. Do you give up and let evil win, or stand up and fight?
I'll go with you--but I won't ask my men to follow.
You don't have to. The Jedi's right. We can't let those scum beat us.
Count me in. Always wanted to fight alongside a Jedi.
You'll need to take down the base's security network so we can get inside.
Once the network's down, we'll attack the back entrance. You take the front. We'll rendezvous in the base.
Be strong, all of you. I'll see you on the inside.
May the Force be with us.
Is there a reason you're afraid to come in the front door with me?
Why are we splitting up?
My team's at half-strength--and you have a lightsaber.
Don't let me down, Sergeant.
You'd better be there.
We won't fail. You have my word.
Let's double-time it, men! Move, move!
With an attitude like that, you'd be useless anyway. Stay. I'll handle this myself.
Not for losers like you.
Don't know if even a Jedi has a chance against Black Sun, but you're brave to try.
You'll have to knock out their security network before you can get inside. If anything goes wrong, fall back here.
Keep this building secure, Sergeant. Just in case.
Thank you for the offer.
Gangsters are no match for a Jedi.
I won't need to fall back.
If you say so.
I'm not coming back to this den of cowards.
Hide with fools? Not likely.
Don't call us cowards until you've met the enemy yourself.
Good luck, Jedi. You'll need it.
You men will do everything you can to assist me. We're going to the base--now.
[Force Persuade] Follow me.
We're going to the base now. On your feet, men. Ration your medical supplies and give some to the Jedi.
The enemy has a computerized security network. We'll keep their forces busy while you take it out.
Once it's down, we'll make a frontal assault and clear a path for you.
That will be all, Sergeant. Get going.
Move out.
You will do your jobs, no matter the cost.
Don't fail me.
We'll fight to the last man. You have my word.
Good boy.
You certainly put the fight back in us.
Sergeant = logic error // T7 = cannot resolve
Take this. We'll see you inside the base.
My men are wounded. I've got no time for you.
